unnormalised: ## Ace Your Exams with These Awesome Exam Prep Apps!
normalised: ## Ace Your Exams with These Awesome Exam Prep Apps!

unnormalised: Hey guys! Exam season is just around the corner, and if you're anything like me (a perpetually stressed-out student!), you're probably feeling the pressure. But don't worry, because your friendly neighbourhood blogger is here to share some seriously helpful exam prep apps that can turn that exam anxiety into exam *mastery*.
normalised: Hey guys! Exam season is just around the corner, and if you're anything like me (a perpetually stressed-out student!), you're probably feeling the pressure. But don't worry, because your friendly neighborhood blogger is here to share some seriously helpful exam prep apps that can turn that exam anxiety into exam mastery.

unnormalised: Forget lugging around heavy textbooks, this is the age of education technology! I remember back in my day, all we had were dusty notes and maybe a Model Test Paper from S. Chand publications. Now, kids have amazing resources right at their fingertips.
normalised: Forget lugging around heavy textbooks, this is the age of education technology! I remember back in my day, all we had were dusty notes and maybe a Model Test Paper from S. Chand publications. Now, kids have amazing resources right at their fingertips.

unnormalised: So, what are my top recommendations? First up is **Testbook**. They have a huge range of practice tests, especially useful for cracking those competitive exams like JEE and NEET. Plus, they have content in multiple languages, which is a huge win for students from all over India. Think Hindi, Tamil, Bengali - you name it!
normalised: So, what are my top recommendations? First up is T E S T B O O K. They have a huge range of practice tests, especially useful for cracking those competitive exams like J E E and N E E T. Plus, they have content in multiple languages, which is a huge win for students from all over India. Think Hindi, Tamil, Bengali - you name it!

unnormalised: Next, there's **BYJU'S**. Love 'em or hate 'em, they make learning engaging with their visually appealing lessons. Perfect for those tricky concepts in Physics and Maths. My younger cousin, Priya, used it to get a killer score in her Class 10 boards.
normalised: Next, there's B Y J U apostrophe S. Love 'em or hate 'em, they make learning engaging with their visually appealing lessons. Perfect for those tricky concepts in Physics and Maths. My younger cousin, Priya, used it to get a killer score in her Class ten boards.

unnormalised: Another app I've heard great things about is **Gradeup** (now known as "BYJU'S Exam Prep," interestingly enough!). They offer daily quizzes and mock tests, which is fantastic for staying consistent with your revision. And the community aspect is cool – you can connect with other students and discuss doubts. Remember that physics problem you were struggling with, the one about lenses? Gradeup probably has a solution.
normalised: Another app I've heard great things about is Gradeup (now known as "B Y J U apostrophe S Exam Prep," interestingly enough!). They offer daily quizzes and mock tests, which is fantastic for staying consistent with your revision. And the community aspect is cool – you can connect with other students and discuss doubts. Remember that physics problem you were struggling with, the one about lenses? Gradeup probably has a solution.

unnormalised: Don’t forget about **Unacademy** too! Their educators are top-notch, and they offer live classes which can feel almost as good as being in a real classroom. Plus, many courses are available for free!
normalised: Don’t forget about Unacademy too! Their educators are top-notch, and they offer live classes which can feel almost as good as being in a real classroom. Plus, many courses are available for free!

unnormalised: Finally, a little something for everyone – **Khan Academy**. It's free, comprehensive, and covers a massive range of subjects. From basic arithmetic to advanced calculus, Khan Academy has got your back. Think of it as your free online tutor, available 24/7. Plus, it can help you if you're stuck on a seemingly easy topic.
normalised: Finally, a little something for everyone – Khan Academy. It's free, comprehensive, and covers a massive range of subjects. From basic arithmetic to advanced calculus, Khan Academy has got your back. Think of it as your free online tutor, available twenty four seven. Plus, it can help you if you're stuck on a seemingly easy topic.

unnormalised: Pro-tip: Don’t just download all these apps and then forget about them! Use them consistently, even if it's just for 30 mins a day. Dedicate a small area, maybe a 100 sq ft space, to study and minimize distraction. Imagine cracking your exams, landing a spot at IIT-Delhi or AIIMS, and making your parents proud – all thanks to these awesome apps and a little bit of hard work!
normalised: Pro-tip: Don’t just download all these apps and then forget about them! Use them consistently, even if it's just for thirty minutes a day. Dedicate a small area, maybe a one hundred square feet space, to study and minimize distraction. Imagine cracking your exams, landing a spot at I I T-Delhi or A I I M S, and making your parents proud – all thanks to these awesome apps and a little bit of hard work!

unnormalised: I've spent Rs. 20000 on courses on some of these apps. Worth every rupee! Remember, Dr. Kalam always said, "Dream, dream, dream. Dreams transform into thoughts and thoughts result in action." Now go ace those exams!
normalised: I've spent rupees twenty thousand on courses on some of these apps. Worth every rupee! Remember, Doctor Kalam always said, "Dream, dream, dream. Dreams transform into thoughts and thoughts result in action." Now go ace those exams!
